definition: millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We share one heart, one home, and one gloriousdestiny.
sentences.chinese: 我们万众一心，同住一个家园，共享辉煌命运。

sentences.english: In the end it was the unity and spirit of these same people that led to his downfall.
sentences.chinese: 最终导致人们团结一致，万众一心将他推倒。

sentences.english: We share one heart, one home, and one glorious destiny.
sentences.chinese: 我们万众一心，同住一个家园，共享荣耀的成就。

sentences.english: Wenchuan earthquake, a strong unity of the Chinese people unprecedented concerted efforts of one mind.
sentences.chinese: 汶川地震，坚强的中国人空前团结万众一心众志成城。

definition: unity of will is an impregnable stronghold (idiom)
to be of one mind/to work as one
of one mind (idiom)
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to twist together to form a rope/(fig.) to unite/to work together
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
concerted efforts in a common cause (idiom); united and working together
to unite/unity/solidarity/united
to work as one (idiom); united in a concerted effort/working hard together
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
unity is strength (revolutionary slogan and popular song of 1943)

definition: to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
